content:
# I successfully crafted a stone furnace and an iron gear wheel. My inventory now contains 1 stone furnace, 1 iron gear wheel, 5 coal, 5 iron ore, and 1 iron plate.

# With the stone furnace crafted, I can now place it down and use it for further smelting or crafting processes. 

# I will place the new stone furnace next to the existing one to create an organized layout for future operations.

# First, I need to determine a suitable position for the new furnace. I will place it next to the existing furnace.

# Let's use the position of the existing furnace and place the new one next to it.
existing_furnace_position = Position(x=0.0, y=0.0)  # Position of the existing furnace
new_furnace_position = Position(x=0.0, y=2.0)  # Position for the new furnace, directly below the existing one

# Place the new stone furnace
new_furnace = place_entity(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=new_furnace_position)

# Now, I can also insert some coal and iron ore into the new furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, new_furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert coal into the new furnace
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, new_furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert iron ore into the new furnace

# Finally, let's check the status of the new furnace to confirm everything is set up correctly.
print(f"New Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(new_furnace)}")  # Check the contents of the new furnace
print(f"Updated Inventory after placing new furnace: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Confirm inventory after placing the new furnace.
